text: Psalm 48
The Greatness of God in Zion
A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah.\f + \fr Ps 48 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Yahweh \add is\add* great and very worthy of praise
in the city of our God, in his ⸤holy mountain⸥.\f + \fr 48:1 \ft Literally “mountain of holiness” \f*
Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth,

\add is\add* ⸤Mount Zion⸥,\f + \fr 48:2 \ft Literally “the mountain of Zion” \f* ⸤in the far north⸥,\f + \fr 48:2 \ft Literally “far of north”; the word translated “north” could refer to Mount Zaphon \f*
\add the\add* city of \add the\add* great king.
God \add is\add* in her citadels;
he is known as a \add high\add* stronghold.
For see, the kings assembled;\f + \fr 48:4 \ft That is, preparing for battle \f*
they advanced together.
⸤They themselves saw⸥\f + \fr 48:5 \ft Literally “They, they saw” \f* \add it\add*, so they were astonished.
They were terrified; they ran off.
Trembling seized them there—
pain as of a woman in labor.
With an east wind

you shatter\f + \fr 48:7 \ft A few Hebrew manuscripts read “like an east wind \fq that \ft shatters” \f* the ships of Tarshish.\f + \fr 48:7 \ft That is, ships \fq that can sail to \ft Tarshish, i.e. well built, able to traverse great distances \f*
As we have heard, so we have seen
in the city of Yahweh of hosts, in the city of our God.
God will establish her forever. \qs Selah\qs*
We have pondered your loyal love, O God,
in the midst of your temple.
As \add is\add* your name, O God, so \add is\add* your praise
to \add the\add* ends of \add the\add* earth.
Your right hand is full of righteousness.
Let ⸤Mount Zion⸥\f + \fr 48:11 \ft Literally “the mountain of Zion” \f* rejoice;
let the daughters of Judah rejoice
because of your judgments.
Walk about Zion and circle it;
count her towers.
⸤Consider well⸥\f + \fr 48:13 \ft Literally “Set your heart to” \f* her ramparts.
Go through her citadels
so that you can tell \add the\add* next generation
that this \add is\add* God, our God forever and ever.
⸤He himself⸥\f + \fr 48:14 \ft Literally “he, he will …” \f* will guide us until death.
